briefTitle: Metoprolol to Reduce Perioperative Myocardial Injury
officialTitle: Metoprolol to Reduce Perioperative Myocardial Injury
summary: The purpose of this research study is to test if a commonly used, FDA-approved medication, called metoprolol, given at the conclusion of anesthesia following surgery, and during postoperative admission, reduces the possibility of heart related complications in patients with coronary artery disease (CAD).

primaryOutcome.measure: Effectiveness of Beta-blocker Therapy Reducing Post-operative Myocardial Injury
